Wish me luck, Underdog. It's my first class as a serious law student. She kisses him and looks down at her completely inappropr skimpy Gucci outfit, which she accents by putting on tren wire-rimmed glasses.
(continuing; to herself)
I totally look the part!

Elle heads for a classroom, amidst a crowd of students wh eye her like she's an alien. She rounds a corner, seeing WARNER, in all his handsome glory, looking over his sched She starts toward him, as if pulled by a magnetic force. Arrogant Aaron sees her passing by.
(seductively)

H l o t e e. . . . . . . el hr. Elle keeps going, not even noticing him. Eyes only for Warner. Arrogant Aaron stomps away, pissed at the perceiv blow-off. As Elle gets closer to Warner, she opts for wandering pas him, seemingly oblivious to his presence.
(stunned)
Elle?! Elle turns, ultra-nonchalant.
Warner?! Oh my God, I completely forgot you were going here! He looks at her, confused.    People walk by, staring.
What're you talking about? You're not here to see me?
No, silly.    I go here.
(still confused)
You go where?
Harvard. Law school.
v- y --                   Y ou g o t in to Ha rv a rd L aw ?
(con fuse d at his confusion) W h at , like it's that.hard?
W a rn e r stares at her :-- completely discombobulated. s m i l es sweetly and makes a show of checking her watch
(continuing) Oops! Time for class. Meet me after? On the benches?
Uh -- sure.
She sashays off with a confident smile.
Students file in and take their seats. Elle enters, looki around nervously at the imposing auditorium. Arrogant Aar next to her, leans over.
If you're looking for the best seat, I hear the front row is the place to be.
Elle smiles at him.
Thanks.
PROFESSOR ELSPETH STROMWELL, a tough-as-nails Grande Dame her 50' s , addresses the class. Laptops abound -- except Elle, who has a fuzzy pink notebook and a pen with a pink plastic heart on the end.
A legal education means you will learn to speak in a new language. You will be taught to achieve insight into the world around you, and to sharply question what you know.
Everyone soaks this up.        Including Elle.
(continuing)

The seat you've picked is yours for the next nine months of your life. Enjoy it. And those of you in the front row, beware.      .    .. El le , in the front row, between two UNSHOWERED BRANIACS looks around, panicked. One of the braniacs passes her th seating chart and she has no choice but to sign her name. In the back, Arrogant Aaron nudges his friend and smiles.
(continuing)
"The law is reason free from passion." Does anyone know who spoke those immortal words? Dorky David raises his hand.
(continuing)
Yes?
(confidently)
Aristotle. Professor Stromwell approaches him the way Cruella de Vil approaches a puppy.
Are you sure? Now he's not.
Yes?
~        Would you be willing to stake your life on it?
I think so...
H o w about -- She spins around, roughly POKING another student in the h
(continuing)
-- his life?
(scared)
I don't know.
Well, I recommend knowing before speaking.. The law leaves much room for interpretation -- but very little for self-doubt. As she turns away --
(continuing)
And you were right. It was Aristotle. The class half-laughs in relief.
(continuing)
I assume you've all read pages 1- 48 and are now well-versed in subject matter jurisdiction. Elle looks around, surprised, as students open their book
(continuing)
Who can tell us about Gordon v. Steele? Silence.   Stromwell looks down at the seating chart.
(continuing)
Ivan Greenstein? Intense Ivan straightens in his' seat.
Gordon sued her doctors for malpractice.
And what did the dispute entail? (looking at her chart)
Let's call on someone in the hot zone. Elle Woods? Elle looks up, distressed.
Uh... I wasn't aware that we had an assignment.
(looking at her chart)
Sarah Knottingham? SARAH KNOTTINGHAM -- a prim and preppy blue-blood brunett dressed in pearls and a sweater set -- looks up.
(continuing)
Do you think it's acceptable that Ms. Woods is unprepared? Sarah looks over at Elle. Elle gives her a mortified smil Sarah turns back to Professor Stromwell.
No, I don't.
Would you support my decision to ask her to leave and return to class only when she is prepared?
Absolutely. Elle can't believe that this girl would betray her. Havin no choice,, she gathers her purse and goes, completely humiliated. Professor Stromwell returns to the matter at hand.
Now, Ms. Knottingham, did diversity jurisdiction'exist in this case?
EMMETT -- a shy and quirkily handsome 28-year-old who cou pass for younger -- sits on a bench, going over some pape He looks up and spots Elle -- sitting across from him -- looking traumatized.
Are you okay? Elle looks up, snapping out of her stupor.
Do they just -- put you on the spot like that? Like, all the time?
The professors? Yeah, they tend- to do that. Socratic method.
And if you don't know the answer, they just kick you out?
He smiles.
You have Stromwell.
(hopeful) Did she do that to you, too?
No, but she made me cry once. Not in class -- I waited until I got to my room, but yeah, she can pretty much shrivel your balls -- or you know, your whatevers .
(stricken) Neat .                 '   ,   '
Don't worry. It gets better. Who else do you have?
Elle looks at her schedule.
Donovan, Royalton and Levinson.
Speak up in Donovan's class. He likes people with an opinion. Sit in the back for Royalton. He tends to spit when he talks about products liability.
Elle makes a face.      He smiles.   Liking her.
(continuing)
And make sure you read the footnotes in Levinson's class. That's where all her exam questions come from.
Wow.   I ' m glad I met you. She smiles at him, grateful.
Oh, and getting one of Stromwell's daily quotes right is almost as important as acing the mid-term. But you didn't hear it from me. Students trickle out of the building.
Are you a third-year? Warner walks up, behind Emmett, interrupting.
Hey. Elle looks up, pure adoration on her face.
Hi! Emmett rises and walks off.
Good luck.
(calling after him)
Thanks again for your help! Warner remains standing, still somewhat uncomfortable wit her presence here.
S o -- uh -- how was your first class?
Fine. Except for this horrible girl who made me look bad in front of my Civ Pro professor. But no biggie. You're here now.
(perky)
How was your summer? She pats the bench beside her.     He doesn't move.
(distracted)
Good. Good.
Do anything exciting? A female hand snakes around Warner's chest from behind. Warner turns and brings the owner of the hand around to h side, presenting her.
(nervous)
Urn, hey, have you met Sarah? Sarah, the horrible girl herself, holds out her hand to E full of contempt.
Hi.     Sarah Knottingham.
(to Warner; horrified)
You know her?
She 's -- Sarah jumps in.
-- I ' m his fiancee. Elle stares at her. Sarah tucks a piece of her mousy brow hair behind her ear and there it is -- The Rock.
(in disbelief)
I'm sorry, I just hallucinated.
Sarah was my girlfriend at prep school. We got back together over the summer at my grandmother's birthday party. Elle looks stricken.     Sarah gives her a smug smile.
Warner told me all about you. You're famous at our Club. She says it in a way that is anything but flattering.   I fact, it's completely condescending.
(continuing; pointedly)
But he didn't tell me you'd be here.
I didn't know -- Elle looks from Warner to Sarah.
Excuse me. She rushes off.    Sarah watches her go, a smug grin on h
face,
(to Warner)
I thought you said she was pretty.

head_text.subj: EXT. STREET/INT. ELLE'S CONVERTIBLE BOXSTER- DAY

text: Elle drives, wiping the tears from her face. She spots something off to the side and SWERVES her car toward it, gasp of hope escaping her lips. Her car stops in front of a strip mall salon called "Beau Oasis".

A downscale, blue-collar salon, with five hair chairs and manicure stations. Old ladies and young waitresses get pe PAULETTE --early 40s, lower-middle class, hard-edged, plu sirzed -- looks up as a defeated Elle sinks into the mani chair.(The manicure station is plastered with pictures of RUFUS, a big, slobbering pit-bull).
Bad day? Elle holds out her hands. Paulette dips them into a dish soapy water.
You can't even imagine.
.Spill., Elle lets it all out in a rush.

I worked really hard to get into law school -- I blew off Spring Break and Greek Week to study for the LSATs, I completely neglected my Homecoming Queen duties, I hired a Coppola to direct my admissions video -- all so I could get my boyfriend Warner back and now he's engaged to this awful girl Sarah so it was all for nothing! I wish I ' d never even come to Harvard. Paulette dries Elle's hands and begins filing.
After you went to all that trouble?
Well, what am I supposed to do? He's engaged! She's got the family six-carat on her bony, unpolished finger.
You're asking the wrong girl. I ' m with my guy eight years and then one day it's "I met someone else. Move out."
(horrified)
What'd you do?
Cried a lot and gained twenty pounds. Dewey kept the trailer and my precious baby Rufus. I got jackcrap. She looks at a picture of the pit-bull.
(continuing; re the dog)
I didn't even get to go to his birthday party.
No!
What could I do?                                          (shrugging)

He's a man who followed his pecker to                     greener pastures. I ' m a middle-aged high-               school dropout with stretch marks and a                   fat ass. Happens every day. At least to                   women like me.
That's terrible!
So, what's this Sarah got that you don't? Three tits?
She's from Connecticut. She belongs to his stupid country club.
Is she as pretty as you? Elle looks down.
(embarrassed)
I ' m not pretty -- I ' m genetically blessed. Paulette rolls her eyes, shaking her bottle of polish and starting on Elle's right hand.
Is sJie.?
She could use some mascara and some serious highlights, but she's not completely unfortunate- looking.

Hello, ladies.                                            Paulette looks up to see the UPS GUY, a strapping hunk of man in his late 30' s . She blushes and smooths down her knocking over a bottle of nail polish in the process. Try to play it off as she signs for the package.
See ya later. He goes. Paulette watches him. Elle notices.
(hating herself)                               .
Could I be anymore goddamn spastic? (beat)
So you're sure, this Warner guy is "the one"?
Definitely! I love him! Paulette looks at her.
If a girl like you can't hold on to her man -- then there sure as hell isn't any hope for the rest of us. What're you waiting for? Steal the bastard back.
Elle knocks on Warner's door, bottle of wine and two glas in hand.
Warner? When she gets no answer, she write a message on his memo board -- CLOSE ON-- "Call me! Love, You Know Who". She leaves the wine bottle and two glasses and goes.

Elle is in her push-up bikini, reclining in her beach cha pink frozen margarita in one hand, Underdog in the other, book in her lap, pretending to study. We PULL BACK to reveal that she's sitting on the sideline a touch-football game that Warner is playing with a group other 1-L's. Warner scores easily because the other male eyes are all Elle. He shakes his head and smiles.

Elle sits, glaring at Sarah, who keeps waving her "The Ro in Elle's direction, as she plays footsie with Warner. PROFESSOR DONOVAN -- 40s, a big fan of himself, salt and pepper hair, no time for bullshit -- stands before the cl

I should warn you that in addition to competing against each other for the top grade in this class, you'll also be competing for one of my firm's highly coveted four internship spots next year where you will get to assist on actual cases. Let the bloodbath begin. Now, let's commence with our usual torture -- He looks around.
(continuing)
Ms . Woods -- Sarah and her bitchy, clone-like friend CLAIRE exchange knowing glances.
This should be amusing.
Would you rather have a client who committed a crime malum in se or malum prohibitum?
Neither.
Why not?
I'd rather have a client who's innocent. Elle smiles, proud of her answer. The class snickers. War frowns.
.        Dare to dream, Ms. Woods. Ms. Knottingham? Which would you prefer?
Malum prohibitum. Because the client would've committed a regulatory infraction as opposed to a dangerous crime.
Elle raises her hand.
Yes?   Ms. Woods?
I changed my mind. I ' d pick the dangerous one.
She looks pointedly at Sarah.
(continuing) I ' m not afraid of a challenge.
Sarah glares back at her. Warner looks between the two of them, worried.
The Harvard Public Interest Law Association meeting is

O        underway. Warner .listens intently, A few seats appears to be taking notes. C L O SE ON--her "notes" -- "I'm free for dinner tonight. me at The Cask & Flagon at 8." She folds the note and sticks it in Underdog's mouth, the him toward Warner. Humiliated but dutiful, Underdog bound CLOSE ON -- Underdog, as he carries forth his mission, arriv ing at Warner's feet. UNDERDOG'S POV -- Warner discreetly takes the note from him, then looks over at El who feigns interest in the meeting.
Elle waits for Warner, alone at a table. Checking her wat to see it's 8:45, she tries not to be sad.
Warner and his study group, Sarah and Claire included, si a table, going over their outlines. Elle walks up to the table, holding a basket of muffins, bright smile on her f
'        I ' m here to join your study group. And look! I brought sustenance! She holds up the muffins as the others look up, frowns al around.
(nervously looking at Sarah)

Our group is full.
Oh, God, was this like an RSVP thing?
No, it's like a smart people thing.     And like Sarah said, we're full.
Come on ~ we can make room for one more. Sarah looks at Warner with evil eyes.
We've already assigned the outlines, and everyone has started theirs',
(to Warner)
Besides, you wouldn't let the fat guy _    join.
He tried to watch me take'a shower! Sarah looks at Elle.
The answer is no. Warner looks at her, feeling guilty. He shrugs an "I'm sorry", but Elle's perkiness has gone.
She gathers up her muffins and stands, clutching the bask to her chest as she goes.
Then I guess I'll leave you alone. She walks away, completely deflated, passing by the RAGIN FEMINIST STUDY GROUP. Enid calls out.
Maybe there's a sorority you could join instead. Elle stops and looks at her.
(to Enid)
You know, if you'd come to a Rush party, I would've at least been nice to you.
Before you voted against me and called me a dyke behind my back?

I don't use that word. Only mean people use that word. You must've heard it from Sarah.                     . She looks back at Warner's table and walks off. As she do she's nearly mowed down by a gaggle of NERDS led by DORKY DAVID, who knock the muffins out of her hands. She stands there, even more depressed.
Elle sinks down onto her bed, deflated.    She picks up t phone and dials.
Serena, with a new hairdo, and Margot are surrounded by wedding dresses. Margot talks on her cell phone. We INTERCUT.
(to Serena)
It's Elle! (into phone)
Guess what I ' m doing right this second?
Power yoga?
Picking out my wedding dress!
What?!
Josh proposed!
(startled) N o way --
Serena grabs the phone.
(into phone) ;;po you have The Rock yet?
Elle lies.
Almost.
Well, hurry up so you can come home!   We miss you!
I miss you guys! The people here are so vile! Hardly anyone even talks to me unless it's to say something that's not nice. Law school sucks!
Oh, my God!   I completely forgot to tell you!
What?
I got bangs!
(hurt and annoyed) Re a ll y --
Margot grabs the phone back.
(into phone)
Keep June first open -- you're one of my bridesmaids. And give Warner our love.
Iwl. il.   .    .
Margot hangs up and Elle follows suit.      Even more def

That-'s genius. Elle pops her head out of the room.
(excited)
No way! Someone at this school is actually having a party? Sarah and Claire turn around.      Elle's face falls when sees that it's them.
No.
You must've heard us wrong.
Sorry. Looks like you'll be staying home ton ig ht. Alone. They continue on as Elle goes back into her room, snubbed
Elle shuts the door behind her and looks at Underdog.
I can't believe this. Not only do I not have Warner, but I ' m --unpopular! The realization hits her hard. Underdog barks.       She
(continuing)
But I wasn't invited. He barks again.
(continuing)
You really think I should?
Two feet in high heels and fishnet hose stride purposeful up the sidewalk.                                    . A perfect butt wearing a bunny tail wiggles up the steps.

A party filled with people who are no fun to party with. NAMETAGS denote which famous defendant everyone is dresse Menenedez's, Tonya Harding's, and Buttafuco's pepper the Elle, decked out in a Playboy Bunny costume -- looking se as hell -- strides in. People roll their eyes and ignore her. Elle continues on. NEARBY -- Enid, dressed as Lizzie Borden, axe in hand/ is the midst of a tirade against some guy dressed like Willi Kennedy Smith.

The English language is all about subliminal domination. Take the word "semester". It's a perfect example of this school's discriminatory preference of semen to ovaries. That's why I ' m petitioning to have next term be referred to as Winter Ovester. The guy backs up in fright. As Elle passes, Enid looks ov
(continuing)
Hey , Elle-- I've been meaning to ask you (re her boobs)
-- are those real? Elle snorts.
Enid, please -- silicone is so 90's.
56 She keeps walking.
Sa rah -- dressed as Hester Prynne -- and Claire --as Joa Arc -- sip wine.
(continuing; sarcastic)
Thanks for inviting me, girls. This party is super fun. They roll their eyes, checking out her Bunny costume.
You're supposed to be dressed as a famous defendant. Elle smiles at Sarah.
I am. Didn't you hear about the Playboy Bunny who slit her ex- boyfriend's new fiancee's throat with a broken wine glass? It was tragic. She grabs a glass of wine and moves on.
Elle walks onto the back porch and finds Warner --dressed O.J. in a USC football uniform, number 32, with a ball an chain on his foot.
Hey, O.J. Warner turns. He looks around for Sarah.      Not seeing smiles at Elle, admiring her costume.
Wow.    You're a walking felony.
Thank you.     Having fun?
( c h e c k i n g her out)
Now I am.
(flirty)
I feel like we've barely spent any time together since we got here.
That's because I spend all my time with case studies and hypos.
Tell me about it. I can't imagine doing all this and Donovan's internship next year.
(scoffing)
Elle, c'mon, there's no way you'll get the grades to qualify for one of those spots . You're not smart enough. She can't believe he's saying this.   He realizes he's go too far, and back-pedals.
(continuing)
I didn't mean --
(cutting him off)
Am I on glue, or did I not get into the same law school you did, Warner?
(covering)
We ll , yeah, but --
But what? We took the same LSAT, we take th e same classes --
I just don't want to see you get your hopes up. You know how you get. She stares at him.   Realizing the awful truth.
I'11 never be good enough for you, will
When he doesn't answer, she walks back into the house.
A group of tipsy ILs stand around. bowl filled with cash.
I give her two more weeks. She throws a twenty into the bowl.      '    .   .
Two and a half? He throws in his twenty as well.
If she spreads her legs, maybe --
(adjusting his crotch)
Only if I ' m feeling generous.
What is this? They turn around to find Elle standing there.
We're betting on how much longer you're going to last.
(stung)
What?
Look around, Elle.      Do you actually think you belong here? They all stare at her.
(hurt)
Why wouldn't I?
Because the rest of us provide some worthwhile value to society?
Hold on, now -- every society needs a bimbo. Who are we supposed to sleep with after we get rich?
59 Elle looks like she's been slapped. The others laugh at Aaron's esteemed wit.
You know what? All of you can just kiss my ass. She yanks off her Bunny tail and throws it at them. Hurt anger in her eyes. Then walks out of the room.
(continuing; to herself)
You're about to see just how valuable Elle Woods can be. She stomps out of the house.
A hot pink laptop is yanked off the shelf.

Elle, still in her Bunny suit, minus the tail, stands in line, paying for the laptop. People gape at her, but she' oblivious in her resolve. EMMETT walks up behind her in line.   He clears his throa trying not to look at her costume. Elle turns, seeing him.
Don't ask.
Wasn't gonna.                                - She marches off.   Laptop in hand.

A pony-tailed Elle types a brief, coffee next to her. Underdog sleeps nearby, belly-up. Legs twitching in a nightmare. Typing furiously, Elle breaks a nail, then struggles to forge on, despite her instinct to stop and repair it.
Elle -- arms full of books -- walks past the Warner/Sarah study group. Sarah and Claire scowl at her, but Elle pass with her head held high.
Enid is surrounded by study materials and notecards. When she gets up to use the ladies' room, Elle casually walks and slips a notecard into the middle of Enid's stack. The quickly walks on. '
Pau lett e quizzes Elle from a law textbook as her nails As she waits for Elle's answer, Paulette showers Underdog with kisses, showing him pictures of Rufus.
Donovan is in the midst of a lecture.     He points at El
And the purpose of "diminished capacity" is? She swallows nervously, then speaks.
To negate mens rea? Donovan nods affirmatively and continues.      Elle hides smile.

Elle reaches for a book on a high shelf, but she's not ta enough. She tries a running start and leaps for it. Still missing it. FROM THE LEFT, she runs and leaps again, missing again. FROM THE RIGHT, she runs and leaps again, missing again. Dorky David walks up and sets down a step-stool at her: f Now winded, she smiles her thanks, stepping up to retriev her book.

Enid flips through her notecards, memorizing, when she co upon a picture of a NAKED MAN. Oh, the horror. She throws down in disgust as if her eyes have been burned. Looking around, Enid sees Elle smiling and waving at her across the room.

Elle walks past Arrogant Aaron, as he sleeps at his study cubicle, head back on the chair. She stops, backs up, and waves her hand over his face. Wh he doesn't stir, she takes a magic marker out of her knap and leans over to write something on his forehead.
69 Elle works out on her Elliptical Crosstrainer as she list to a lecture tape and watches Court TV on mute.
"A failure to act can constitute the actus reus for accomplice liability if the defendant has the legal duty intervene, but fails to do so."
Arrogant Aaron wakes up with a start, checks his watch, a rushes off to class. Oblivious to his facial graffiti, wh we can't yet read.
Professor Stromwell is in front of the class.
So you've filed a claim. Now what? She looks over to see Elle sitting there, typing on her laptop.
(continuing)
Ms. Woods?
Don't you also need to have evidence?
Meaning? Everyone now stares at Elle.
Meaning you need -- reasonable belief that your claim would have, like, evidentiary support? Stromwell is somewhat impressed, but doesn't show it.

And what kind of evidentiary support does this case require? Let's ask Mr. Harriman, who clearly believes that I might be hungry. She looks up at Arrogant Aaron in the back row. Who unknowingly has "Eat Me" written on his forehead. He look back at her, confused, as the students around him snicker

A "Closed" sign is on the door. THROUGH THE WINDOW, we see Elle and Paulette sitting in t empty salon, laughing and clinking cans of Pabst Blue Rib as they toast Elle's small victory. We PULL BACK, leaving them laughing, as the MONTAGE ENDS.
"THE STATE V. LATIMER" is written on the board. A pony- tailed, less made-up Elle takes notes on her lap-top, as Warner makes an argument.

. According to Swinney v. Neubert, Swinney, who was also a private sperm donor, was allowed visitation rights as long as he came to terms with the hours set forth by the parents. So, if we're sticking to past precedent, Mr. Latimer wasn't st al ki ng -- he was clearly within his rights to ask for visitation.
But Swinney was a one-time sperm donor, and in our case, the defendant was a habitual sperm donor, who also happens to be harassing the parents in his quest for visitation.
But , without this man's sperm --the child in question would not exist.
He grins and looks around as the class murmurs their agreement.
Now you're thinking like a lawyer.
EMMETT enters from the back, holding a file.        He st quietly, watching.  Elle tentatively raises her hand.
Ms. Woods? Sarah looks at Claire.
(sotto)
The idiot speaks.
Although Mr. Huntington makes an excellent point, I have to wonder if the defendant kept a thorough record of each sperm emission made throughout his life? The class titters.    Elle grows annoyed.
(bemused)
Why do you ask? Elle's hesitancy is replaced by conviction.

Well, unless the defendant attempted to contact every single one-night- stand to determine if a child resulted in those unions -- then he has no parental claim whatsoever over this child. Why this s p e rm ? Why now?      ' Emmett's mouth twitches into a smile.
(continuing) For that matter, all masturbatory emissions where his sperm was clearly not seeking an egg could be termed reckless abandonment.
Warner's mouth hangs open. As does Sarah's and the rest o the class. Donovan smiles.
I believe you've just won your case.
Elle grins.           :
As the students file out, Elle passes Donovan.
You did well today.
She stops.
I did?
You're applying for my internship, aren't you?
I don ' t know --
You should. Do you have a resume?
(excited)
" '.' .  . . . i do. ' ' ,           .''.      ' . .  ; . She pulls a resume out of her briefcase and hands it to h He looks at it.
It's pink.
And engraved... Gives it that extra little something, doesn't it? . (smiling) See you tomorrow!
74 She walks on.     Emmett walks up, handing the file to Do
I brought you the Windham notes.
(watching Elle go)
You think she just woke up one morning and said, "I think I'll go to law school today!"? Ei timett looks after Elle,    bemused.
Aside from that lapse in judgement -- she's got potential.
Elle drives. Paulette is shotgun.
You showed up Warner in class? You're supposed to be showing up Sarah.

I couldn't help it! It was the most fun I've had since I've been in law school. Not only was I good enough for Warner -- I was better than him. He has to see serious I am now. Even Donovan was impressed, and he's a total hard- ass. Elle stops the car and turns off the ignition.
You ready?
No.

Yes, you are.       Go -- you can do this. She points ahead of them.        Paulette goes. 76   EXT. DEWEY'S TRAILER    - DAY               . The door opens. DEWEY(40s) and his beer gut emerge. Paulette is on the porch. Trying to exude confidence, but failing.
9/172000 Revision (Blue)                                5 16

What the hell do yon want? We're eating dinner.
I just --
You just thought you'd come over and show me what I 'm definitely not missing?
She watches, frowning.
Dewey's really having fun now.

That's not what --
How many times you gonna show up here, beggin1 me to take you back?        ' Paulette reddens -- flustered and humiliated.    Elle app next to her.
Dewey Newcomb?
Who's askin'
. I ' m Elle Woods. Ms. Bonaf ante's attorney. Paulette looks at Elle in surprise, Elle keeps going.
Under state law, you and Ms. Bonaf ante had a common law marriage which entitles her to the benefits of property law and an equitable division of assets.
78 Paulette watches Elle, mouth hanging open.
(confused)
Come again?
